channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Roadworks signs left on pavement for weeks and weeks, 21st September
item.description:
There are two roadworks signs that have been left on the pavement outside numbers 62 and 64 Belgrave Road for weeks and weeks now, they are face down and are frankly a public safety hazard. Unfortunately they are just symptomatic of a borough-wide problem now with roadwork signs being left or abandoned by your contractors on pavements and that remain well after works have been finished.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Belgrave Road, Pimlico, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Regular occurrence of fly tipping, 21st September
item.description:
Yet again, someone thought it would be a good idea to dump their soiled double mattress in the corner of Sondes street. This is a regular occurrence of fly tipping and the awful lime bikes being placed alongside the pavement.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sondes Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumping by pharmacy - there all weekend, 21st September
item.description:
Photo before (Friday) and after (Sunday) provided above. Commercial rubbish is put out incorrectly or not collected correctly. This is a long term/semi-permanent issue. This has been reported previously.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Riding House Street, Fitzrovia, Camden Town, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Building materials and fencing on pavement, plus significant damage to the pavement to, 21st September
item.description:
On Friday building materials and a fence have been placed on the pavement outside 10 Bean Road and damage has been caused to the paving slabs which are broken. The foundations below the slabs has been compromised and this has caused subsidence.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bean Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic lights need fixing .Safety issue at these traffic lights as traffic from Southwood Road is released under a green traffic light and are then confronted at 90 degrees from the right by traffic turning right from A20 Sidcup road into Green Lane. Traffic at the front from the green traffic light from Southwood Road then have to brake suddenly to try and avoid collisions with the conflicting A20 Sidcup Road turning traffic. Thank you, 21st September
item.description:
Traffic lights need fixing .Safety issue at these traffic lights as traffic from Southwood Road is released under a green traffic light and are then confronted at 90 degrees from the right by traffic turning right from A20 Sidcup road into Green Lane. Traffic at the front from the green traffic light from Southwood Road then have to brake suddenly to try and avoid collisions with the conflicting A20 Sidcup Road turning traffic. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sidcup Road, New Eltham, London

item.title: Tree roots marked again for covering up., 21st September
item.description:
The tree roots have been tarmarked over so many times and they area has been marked yet again The problem has not been addressed and my wall has now cracked. Why not cut out the root causing the problem. The pavement is getting higher and is quite dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 79, South Hill Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
